sentences.cn: 一幢维多利亚时代的大房子

sentences.en: a day school at Leeds University on women in Victorian times
sentences.cn: 利兹大学为期一天的关于维多利亚时代妇女的专题讲座
动人心弦的维多利亚时代情节剧

sentences.en: Modern furniture would be out of place in a Victorian house.
sentences.cn: 在维多利亚时代式的房子里摆设现代家具很不谐调.

sentences.en: The book is a gem of Victorian idiosyncrasy.
sentences.cn: 这本书展现了维多利亚时代特色的精华。

sentences.en: The most prominent poets of the Victorian period had all but faded from the scene.
sentences.cn: 维多利亚时期最显赫的诗人差不多已全部湮没无声了。

sentences.en: The Victorian Age is often boasted of as an age of progress.
sentences.cn: 维多利亚时代常常被夸耀为进步时代.

sentences.en: The wall caved in to reveal a blocked-up Victorian fireplace.
sentences.cn: 墙坍塌了，露出砌在里面的维多利亚时代的壁炉。

sentences.en: There are some delightful Victorian houses fronting onto the pavement.
sentences.cn: 面对人行道有一些漂亮的维多利亚时代的房子。

sentences.en: There is a huge Victorian edifice in the area.
sentences.cn: 该地区有一幢维多利亚式的庞大建筑物.

sentences.en: Victorian houses can seem cold with their lofty ceilings and rambling rooms.
sentences.cn: 维多利亚式房屋屋顶高耸，房间布局凌乱，因此可能会显得较为阴冷。
维多利亚时代的价值观受到了严重误解。

sentences.en: Victorian women were rarely allowed to express their sexuality.
sentences.cn: 维多利亚时代几乎不让女性表达自己的性兴趣.

sentences.en: We have a lovely old Victorian house.
sentences.cn: 我们有一栋漂亮的维多利亚时代的老房子。

sentences.en: When they were together the Jacobean and the Victorian ages were juxtaposed.
sentences.cn: 她们俩在一块的时候,仿佛是詹姆士时代和维多利亚时代,杂凑在一起.

trans.tran_en: relating to or coming from the period from 1837 – 1901 when Victoria was Queen of England
